title: Mohammed bin Salman - Wikipedia
snippet: In February 2017, Saudi Arabia appointed its first woman to head the Saudi Stock Exchange. Muhammad bin Nayef was arrested on 6 March 2020, along with his half-brother Nawwaf bin Nayef and King Salman's brother Ahmed bin Abdulaziz. The three princes were charged with treason. The Saudi government claimed the princes were trying to overthrow Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Mohammed bin Salman | Biography, Saudi Arabia, Father, & Mother | Britannica
snippet: He is the son of Saudi King Salman bin Abdulaziz and his third wife Fahdah bint Falāḥ ibn Sulṭān. From a young age Mohammed was interested in government, shadowing his father and remaining conscious about his image.

title: Saudi Arabia - Heads of Government Listing
snippet: The heads of government list is a database that contains information on the names and titles of heads of state, heads of government, foreign ministers, trade ministers and in some cases, ministers responsible for development assistance.&nbsp It has been prepared using information provided by ...

title: Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: Since the reign of King Khalid, others have done much of the "heavy lifting" as the king was either unwilling or unable to carry the workload, especially as the kingdom became a gerontocracy during the 1990s and 2000s. Royal favorites achieved power to become de facto prime ministers. The current one is the King's son Mohammad, who is his father's top aide.

title: Saudi Leadership
snippet: الموقع الرسمي لوزارة الخارجية للمملكة العربية السعودية والذي من خلاله يمكنك الإطلاع على كافة الأحداث الدولية والإقليمية والسياسية والدبلوماسية المتعلقة بالمملكة
